description: Get information about an existing configuration set, including the dedicated IP pool that it's associated with, whether or not it's enabled for sending email, and more. Configuration sets are groups of rules that you can apply to the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.

parameters.name: ConfigurationSetName
parameters.description: The name of the configuration set.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationSetName
nested_items.description: The name of the configuration set.

nested_items.name: TrackingOptions
nested_items.description: An object that defines the open and click tracking options for emails that you send using the configuration set.

nested_items.name: CustomRedirectDomain
nested_items.description: The domain to use for tracking open and click events.

nested_items.name: HttpsPolicy
nested_items.description: The https policy to use for tracking open and click events.

nested_items.name: DeliveryOptions
nested_items.description: An object that defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send emails that you send using the configuration set.

nested_items.name: TlsPolicy
nested_items.description: Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is Require, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is Optional, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.

nested_items.name: SendingPoolName
nested_items.description: The name of the dedicated IP pool to associate with the configuration set.

nested_items.name: MaxDeliverySeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that Amazon SES API v2 will attempt delivery of email. If specified, the value must greater than or equal to 300 seconds (5 minutes) and less than or equal to 50400 seconds (840 minutes).

nested_items.name: ReputationOptions
nested_items.description: An object that defines whether or not Amazon SES collects reputation metrics for the emails that you send that use the configuration set.

nested_items.name: ReputationMetricsEnabled
nested_items.description: If true, tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the configuration set. If false, tracking of reputation metrics is disabled for the configuration set.

nested_items.name: LastFreshStart
nested_items.description: The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh start.

nested_items.name: SendingOptions
nested_items.description: An object that defines whether or not Amazon SES can send email that you send using the configuration set.

nested_items.name: SendingEnabled
nested_items.description: If true, email sending is enabled for the configuration set. If false, email sending is disabled for the configuration set.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the configuration set.
Tag keys and values are case sensitive.
For each associated resource, each tag key must be unique and it can have only one value.

TheÂ  aws:Â prefix is reserved for use by Amazon Web Services; you can't use it in any tag keys or values that you define. In addition, you can't edit or remove tag keys or values that use this prefix. Tags that use this prefix don't count against the limit of 50 tags per resource.

You can associate tags with public or shared resources, but the tags are available only for your Amazon Web Services account, not any other accounts that share the resource. In addition, the tags are available only for resources that are located in the specified Amazon Web Services Region for your Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: SuppressionOptions
nested_items.description: An object that contains information about the suppression list preferences for your account.

nested_items.name: SuppressedReasons
nested_items.description: A list that contains the reasons that email addresses are automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This list can contain any or all of the following:
COMPLAINT --- Amazon SES adds an email address to the suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address results in a complaint.
BOUNCE --- Amazon SES adds an email address to the suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address results in a hard bounce.

nested_items.name: VdmOptions
nested_items.description: An object that contains information about the VDM preferences for your configuration set.

nested_items.name: DashboardOptions
nested_items.description: Specifies additional settings for your VDM configuration as applicable to the Dashboard.

nested_items.name: EngagementMetrics
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of your VDM engagement metrics collection. Can be one of the following:
ENABLED --- Amazon SES enables engagement metrics for the configuration set.
DISABLED --- Amazon SES disables engagement metrics for the configuration set.

nested_items.name: GuardianOptions
nested_items.description: Specifies additional settings for your VDM configuration as applicable to the Guardian.

nested_items.name: OptimizedSharedDelivery
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of your VDM optimized shared delivery. Can be one of the following:
ENABLED --- Amazon SES enables optimized shared delivery for the configuration set.
DISABLED --- Amazon SES disables optimized shared delivery for the configuration set.

nested_items.name: ArchivingOptions
nested_items.description: An object that defines the MailManager archive where sent emails are archived that you send using the configuration set.

nested_items.name: ArchiveArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the MailManager archive where the Amazon SES API v2 will archive sent emails.
